title.narrative: F.a: Follow-up study on labour rights in value added chain of Wärtsilä

description.narrative:
In 2014, SASK had Finnwatch compile a research on labour rights and working conditions in the value added chain of Wärtsilä Corporation, a Finnish multinational technology company. Targeted to two countries, Mosambique and India, the field research found serious violations of workers’ rights in one of the sub-contractors for Wärtsilä in Maharashtran state, India. To verify whether a corrective process has been started and whether improvements have taken place in workers’ rights and working condition s, a follow-study will be conducted targeting the Echjay Forgings factory.
The objective of the research is provide practical and useful material for the local trade union partners and Finnish partner unions to participate in negotiating process aimed and improving working conditions and labour rights in the value added chain of the company.
Assigned by SASK, the research will be conducted by Finnwatch in cooperation with Cividep in India.
